intro: Struthanthus grahamii, commonly known as Graham's struthanthus, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Loasaceae family and is characterized by its showy, yellow to orange flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It has small, narrow leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain seeds. Struthanthus grahamii is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats.
